diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of PHP-Ib was made based on clinical findings of hypocalcemia and elevated PTH levels, absence of clinical features of Albright's hereditary osteodystrophy, and genetic confirmation of a heterozygous 3-kb microdeletion within STX16. The patient initially presented with convulsions and low serum calcium, indicative of symptomatic hypocalcemia, which was inconsistent with primary hypoparathyroidism due to the elevated serum PTH levels.
